intro: Selonia soogdiana, commonly known as the Karakum dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Selonia soogdiana has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. It produces a capsule-like fruit that contains numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
